title: Funlab steps up for IPO, JPMorgan kicks off pitch
text:
Leisure and entertainment business Funlab has kicked off its run at the ASX-boards, with its sponsor brokers sending detailed company research reports to fund managers on Wednesday morning.

JPMorgan analysts told funds that Funlab had doubled its number of venues in the past three financial years and was a "robust pipeline" of new sites under its bowling brand Strike, Holey Moley golf, Archie Brothers, B Lucky & Sons and Sky Zone brands.

The analysts told clients Funlab expected $152.4 million operating revenue in the 2020 financial year and $29.2 million in earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation.

Funlab recorded $120.8 million revenue and $18 million EBITDA (before significant items) in the 2019 financial year, on a proforma basis.

Management expects revenue and EBITDA estimates to imply 41 per cent and 59 per cent growth annually between the 2017 and 2020 financial years on a compound annual growth rate basis, the report said.

JPMorgan's team, headed by emerging companies analyst Wei-Weng Chen, stopped short of valuing the business, but presented a big basket of comparable stocks including listed bowling, restaurants, general entertainment and theme parks in Australia and offshore.
description: Leisure and entertainment business Funlab has kicked off its run at the ASX-boards.
